text: I was working the field Just bailing my hay Had my britches hitch-hied On a stupid hot day The sun was burning The sweat rolled down My troubles started when my pants fell down I bent a grab with wine Failed to tug on my drawers Next thing I knew Don't let me lose my family juice The machine kept churning How do I get loose? My nuts being squeezed Like fresh orange juice I kicked and I hauled free He had it out for me Oh boy, you sure are in a deli of a pinco My voice hit notes that I'd never sung Screaming as my two church bells were being rung Oh, my balls got caught in the hay-bailer Preacher's prayer Squeezing, oh shit, I'm pleading Don't let me lose my manly pair The sun you walk just fine But sitting down might take some time My wife just laughed And my kids just scoffed While I limp back off Oh, my quiff all said, oh, a failure It was quite a sight The hay-bailer's grip was a real ball slayer Now the rooster won't crow And the cows won't move The sheep balls scattered When I walked through My wife just laughed When I dropped my drawers But I sent my balls Cause they are so Well, Paul, your nuts look like a belly button Been through a tornado

segments.text: I was working the field Just bailing my hay
Had my britches hitch-hied On a stupid hot day
The sun was burning The sweat rolled down
My troubles started when my pants fell down
I bent a grab with wine Failed to tug on my drawers
Next thing I knew Don't let me lose my family juice
The machine kept churning How do I get loose?
My nuts being squeezed Like fresh orange juice
I kicked and I hauled free He had it out for me
Oh boy, you sure are in a deli of a pinco
My voice hit notes that I'd never sung Screaming as my two church bells were being rung
Oh, my balls got caught in the hay-bailer Preacher's prayer
Squeezing, oh shit, I'm pleading Don't let me lose my manly pair
The sun you walk just fine But sitting down might take some time
My wife just laughed And my kids just scoffed
While I limp back off Oh, my quiff all said, oh, a failure
It was quite a sight The hay-bailer's grip was a real ball slayer
Now the rooster won't crow And the cows won't move
The sheep balls scattered When I walked through
My wife just laughed When I dropped my drawers
But I sent my balls Cause they are so
Well, Paul, your nuts look like a belly button Been through a tornado
